questions.question: One reason the British stopped the policy of salutary neglect after 1763 was-

choices.answer: The British were in debt from the Seven Years War
The British wanted to stop the colonists from rebelling
The colonists were wealthy enough to pay more towards defence
The colonists demanded more services from the British

questions.question: The colonists used the Magna Carta and English Bill of Rights to justify-

choices.answer: the actions of the Paxton Boys
calls for the execution of King George III
the continuation of the Great Awakening
demands to be given traditional rights of British subjects

questions.question: The colonists protested British policies following the French and Indian War because-

choices.answer: they did not believe governments had the right to raise taxes
they did believe the British government was legitimate
they were being taxed without representation in Parliament
they supported the concept of virtual representation

questions.question: Which of these Enlightenment ideas did the colonists use to justify independence?

choices.answer: Government should be limited and based on consent of the people
Governments rule by divine rights given by a Creator
All people are equally fit to rule and participate in the government
Religion is central to the community and must be protected

questions.question: Which of these is an example of how the Enlightenment influenced colonial culture?

choices.answer: Equality between men and women in Quaker societies
An end to primogeniture
Universal suffrage rights to white males
Special legal rights for the nobility class
